wikipedia_page.main: Charles Ashley Teape (16 February 1844 – 1 August 1925) was an English first-class cricketer active 1863–72 who played for Middlesex. He was born in Blackheath, Kent; died in Chelsea. His brother, Arthur, also played first-class cricket.

response: He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh in 1891. His proposers were Rev Henry Calderwood, Robert McNair Ferguson, Andrew Wilson and Charles Teape.
